intro.description: This cheat sheet will guide you through the steps of integrating applications.

item.title: Download Example Source Files
item.description:
To use this tutorial you need some classes provided in your Stardust installation, which are provided in a zipped file.
1. Click the ? in the upper right corner of this task to download the example zip file support-case.zip.
2. Specify a location to unzip the example sources.

item.title: Adding Libraries to the Classpath
item.description:
To make the classes available in the project you can add the source files to your project:
1. Switch to the Package Explorer view.
2. Right-click the src folder of your Support-Case dynamic web project and choose Import...
3. Choose General > File System.
4. Select Next.
5. Browse to <your-support-examples-folder>/support-case/src/java.
6. Check the checkbox beside com to add the package structure of the support-case tutorial classes.
7. Finish to accept the import.

item.title: Creating Application Support Case Factory
item.description:
1. In the diagrams toolbar palette select Applications > Plain Java Application.
2. Place the application symbol on the diagram canvas near the Init Data activity.
3. Double-click to open the application's properties dialog.
4. Set the name to Support Case Factory.
5. On the left side of the panel select Plain Java Application.
6. Browse the classpath to find a class named CreateSupportDataAppl (in package com.sungard.carnot.supportcase).
7. Choose the Completion Method "createCustomer()".
8. Set the constructor to "CreateSupportDataAppl()".
9. OK the dialog.

item.title: Adding Application Notification
item.description:
1. In the diagrams toolbar palette select Applications > Plain Java Application.
2. Place the symbol on the diagram canvas near the Notify Customer activity.
3. Double-click to open the application's properties dialog.
4. Set the name to Notification.

item.title: Adding Properties for Notification
item.description:
Now set the properties for the application:
1. On the left side of the panel select Plain Java Application.
2. Browse to find the class "CreateSupportDataAppl" (in package "com.sungard.carnot.supportcase").
3. Set the Completion Method to "notifyCustomer(java.util.Map)" by selecting it in the pull-down menu opening as soon as you click the Browse button.
4. Set the Constructor to "CreateSupportDataAppl()" by selecting it in the pull-down menu opening as soon as you click the Browse button.
5. OK the dialog.

item.title: Assigning the Applications
item.description:
Now assign the applications to the respective activities:
1. In the diagram toolbar palette select Connect.
2. Click the Support Case Factory application in the diagram.
3. Subsequently click the Init Data activity symbol.
4. Again select Connect.
5. Click the Notification application in the diagram.
6. Subsequently click the Notify Customer activity symbol.
